org.myrobotlab.service

Class Arduino

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.myrobotlab.framework.Service
      • org.myrobotlab.service.Arduino
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.io.Serializable, java.lang.Runnable, java.util.EventListener, MessageConsumer, SerialDeviceEventListener, SerialDeviceService, MotorController, SensorDataPublisher, ServiceInterface, ServoController, StepperController

    public class Arduino
extends Service
implements SerialDeviceEventListener, SensorDataPublisher, ServoController, MotorController, StepperController, SerialDeviceService, MessageConsumer
    Implementation of a Arduino Service connected to MRL through a serial port. The protocol is basically a pass through of system calls to the Arduino board. Data can be passed back from the digital or analog ports by request to start polling. The serial port can be wireless (bluetooth), rf, or wired. The communication protocol supported is in MRLComm.ino Should support nearly all Arduino board types digitalRead() works on all pins. It will just round the analog value received and present it to you. If analogRead(A0) is greater than or equal to 512, digitalRead(A0) will be 1, else 0. digitalWrite() works on all pins, with allowed parameter 0 or 1. digitalWrite(A0,0) is the same as analogWrite(A0,0), and digitalWrite(A0,1) is the same as analogWrite(A0,255) analogRead() works only on analog pins. It can take any value between 0 and 1023. analogWrite() works on all analog pins and all digital PWM pins. You can supply it any value between 0 and 255
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

      • publishPin

        public Pin publishPin(Pin p)
        This method is called with Pin data whene a pin value is changed on the Arduino board the Arduino must be told to poll the desired pin(s). This is done with a analogReadPollingStart(pin) or digitalReadPollingStart()
        Specified by:
        publishPin in interface SensorDataPublisher

      • setSampleRate

        public void setSampleRate(java.lang.Integer rate)
        this sets the sample rate of polling reads both digital and analog it is a loop count modulus - default is 1 which seems to be a bit high of a rate to be broadcasting across the internet to several webclients :) valid ranges are 1 to 32,767 (for Arduino's 2 byte signed integer)
        Parameters:
        rate -
